/>
V.ii.1.A.5.g
.
Reaching a Conclusion After Weighing Evidence
After weighing the evidence to reach a conclusion,
discuss the evidence in favor of the claim
discuss the evidence against the claim to include any negative evidence, and
explain that
one set of evidence outweighs the other set, or
the evidence is in equal balance for and against the claim.
Reference
:Â  For more information on negative evidence, see
Forshey v. Principi
, 284 F.3d 1335 (Fed. Cir. 2002) (en banc), and
Maxson v. Gober
, 230 F.3d 1330 (Fed. Cir. 2000).
title: M21-1, Part V, Subpart ii, Chapter 1, Section A - Principles of Reviewing and Weighing Evidence
citation: Part V, Subpart ii, Chapter 1, Section A
